etymologies: 1970s; earliest use found in IBM Systems Journal. From mini- + disc

definitions: Usually in form minidisk. (A virtual disk consisting of) a logical partition of a larger disk, especially on a mainframe computer.
A floppy disk of a relatively small size; specifically a 5¼-inch (17cm) disk.
Usually in form Minidisc. A trademark for: a magneto-optical disc resembling a small compact disc, which may be used to record sound or other data, or to play pre-recorded music, etc.
